titlestmt.titleproper: College of Physicians of Philadelphia Office of the President records 1948-2006
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: College of Physicians of Philadelphia Office of the President records

bioghist.p: The College of Physicians of Philadelphia, founded in 1787, is the oldest professional medical organization in the country. The College is home to the MÃ¼tter Museum and the Historical Medical Library. Through its program of lectures, workshops, and conferences, as well as through the C. Everett Koop Community Education Center and PhillyHealthInfo.org, an online health information resource, the College provides a place for both medical professionals and the general public to learn about medicine as both a science and as an art. The President of the College of Physicians calls and presides at meetings, appoints committees, serves as an ex-officio member of all committees, and submits a yearly report of the College's activities to the Countil. The President serves a two-year term.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of materials from the Office of the President of the College of Physicians of Philadelphia. The collection includes files from J.P. Hubbard, Katherine Sturgis, R.S. Pressman, Arthur Asbury, and Thomas Langfitt. Records relate to annual meetings, Practice-related Educational Programs (PREP) formation and development, Continuing Medical Education programs, the Building Fund, the Wood Institute, the Ghana Medical College project, development, and strategic planning. Materials include: correspondence, meeting minutes and agendas, memoranda, grant proposals, reports, and speeches.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
